clinical_study.brief_title: Trial of Vitamin D3 Supplementation in Paediatric Autism
clinical_study.official_title: Vitamin D3 for Autism Spectrum Disorder: a Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: To build on a recent case study and open label trial, the investigators want to find out if vitamin D supplementation can influence behavioural and core symptoms of autism.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators will assess behavioural and core symptoms of autism before and after 20 weeks of vitamin D supplementation in a double-blind, placebo-controlled trial.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Positive autism diagnostic observation schedule
- Stable medication regimen
- Tolerate phlebotomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable or very severe autism
- Epilepsy
- Renal/liver/gastrointestinal disease
